item1: Regulation Operations. exploration production operations subject various federal, state local laws regulations, including regulations related following: location wells; method drilling, well construction, well stimulation, hydraulic fracturing casing design; water withdrawal procurement well stimulation purposes; well production; spill prevention plans; use, transportation, storage disposal fluids materials incidental oil gas operations; surface usage reclamation properties upon which wells other facilities been located; plugging abandoning wells; calculation, reporting disbursement royalties taxes; gathering production certain circumstances. These regulations, any delays obtaining related authorizations, may affect costs timing developing natural gas resources. operations also subject conservation correlative rights regulations, including following: regulation size drilling spacing units field rule units; setbacks; number wells may drilled unit close proximity other wells; drilling vicinity coal mining operations certain other structures; unitization pooling natural gas properties.

Recent Significant Events Olympus Energy Acquisition July 1, 2025, completed acquisition (the Olympus Energy Acquisition) certain oil gas properties related upstream midstream assets, including approximately 90,000 net acres approximately 500 million cubic feet (MMcf) per day net production, Olympus Energy LLC, Hyperion Midstream LLC Bow & Arrow Land Company LLC (collectively, Olympus Energy). purchase price Olympus Energy Acquisition consisted 25,229,166 shares EQT common stock, aggregate value $1,471 million based EQT common stock share price $58.32 (the last reported per share sale price EQT common stock day prior completion Olympus Energy Acquisition), approximately $475 million cash, each adjusted pursuant customary purchase price adjustments subject final post-closing purchase price adjustments.
